name: SEBI Reports.txt - Source SFTP accounts:-
description: This section provides information about two SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol) accounts used for transferring files to and from Razorpay's servers. The first account, 'niyo@sftp.razorpay.com', is associated with an Amazon S3 bucket named 'rzp-1415-prod-sftp/niyo/prod', while the second account, 'funds-india@razorpay.com', is linked to the 'rzp-1415-prod-sftp/funds_india' S3 bucket. These accounts and their corresponding S3 buckets are likely used for securely transferring data or files related to specific clients or services offered by Razorpay.
use_cases: Secure file transfer between Razorpay and its clients or partners
Data exchange with specific services or applications
Automated file transfer and storage using SFTP and Amazon S3
capabilities: SFTP accounts for secure file transfer
Integration with Amazon S3 for file storage
Dedicated accounts and buckets for specific clients or services

name: SEBI Reports.txt - Target SFTP accounts (Referenced by their beam jobs) :-
description: This section provides information about the target SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol) accounts that are referenced by their respective beam jobs. use_cases: Transferring files securely between systems or organizations

Centralized management of SFTP account credentials and access

name: SEBI Reports.txt - Lambda triggers:-
description: This section appears to be explaining the Lambda triggers associated with the 'cams_reports' functionality. Lambda triggers are a way to automatically execute code or functions in response to certain events or changes in data. The image provided seems to be a visual representation or diagram related to these Lambda triggers, but without more context, it's difficult to infer the specifics.
